designScenario.name: Fuel Storage System
designScenario.description: A critical subsystem responsible for the safe storage, containment, and management of aviation fuel. It ensures structural integrity, leak prevention, and thermal stability of fuel under extreme altitude variations, temperature fluctuations, and vibration loads. Designed with aerospace-grade materials and redundant safety features to meet FAA/EASA certification requirements.

details.description: The system must maintain complete fuel containment without leaks during all flight phases including maximum turbulence loads (up to 5g) and temperature ranges (-50°C to +70°C).
Tank structure must withstand 200% of maximum expected operational pressure (MEOP) with safety factor of 3.0 against yield failure.
Incorporate inerting gas distribution and flame arrestors to maintain oxygen concentration below 12% in ullage space per FAA AC 25.981-2.
All wetted surfaces shall demonstrate 10,000-hour salt spray resistance without pitting corrosion per ASTM B117 standards.

systemComponents.name: Primary Fuel Tank
systemComponents.description: Main fuel reservoir with integral baffle system to prevent fuel sloshing, constructed from AA7075-T6 aluminum alloy with elastomeric sealing.

subComponents.name: Baffle System
subComponents.description: Anti-slosh partitions with check valves for controlled fuel migration during maneuvers

subComponents.name: Access Panel
subComponents.description: Hermetically sealed inspection port with lightning-safe design

systemComponents.name: Venting System
systemComponents.description: Dual-channel vent network maintaining atmospheric pressure differential <0.25 psi during climb/descent

subComponents.name: Flame Arrestor
subComponents.description: Stainless steel mesh preventing external ignition sources

systemComponents.name: Fuel Quantity Indicating System (FQIS)
systemComponents.description: Capacitive probe array with temperature compensation for ±1% fuel volume accuracy

subComponents.name: Probe Array
subComponents.description: Multi-segment capacitance sensors with anti-icing heaters

subComponents.name: Compensator Unit
subComponents.description: Real-time dielectric constant adjustment based on fuel temperature

systemComponents.name: Refuel/Defuel Manifold
systemComponents.description: Dual-path fueling system with automatic shutoff at 98% capacity

subComponents.name: Fuel Defuel Pump
subComponents.description: 15 l/sec transfer capacity for emergency fuel jettison

relationships.description: The venting system is an integral structural component of the primary fuel tank assembly
Fuel quantity indicating system aggregates measurement data from multiple tank regions
Manifold operation requires real-time tank pressure data from primary tank sensors
Flame arrestor is a permanent sub-component within the venting system ducting

attributes.name: fuelType
attributes.description: Specifies compatible fuel types per API 1581 specifications

attributes.name: tankCapacity
attributes.description: Usable fuel volume at 15°C including expansion margin

attributes.name: temperatureRange
attributes.description: Operational temperature envelope including safety margin

attributes.name: corrosionResistance
attributes.description: Salt spray resistance per ASTM B117 testing standard
